title: MTA was useless in helping woman with subway perv: victim
content:
A Brooklyn woman who had to face a masturbating creep on the subway has turned to social media to warn other…  
BY Thomas Tracy , Dan Rivoli 

NEW YORK DAILY NEWS 

Updated: Wednesday, September 9, 2015, 11:15 PM 

A Brooklyn woman who had to face a masturbating creep on the subway has turned to social media to warn other women — and rail against unhelpful MTA workers. 

Tiffany Jackson, with her pooch in hand, was able to grab photos of the pervert staring her down as he pleasured himself on a Manhattan-bound No. 3 train leaving the Franklin Ave. station. 

“I just wanted to get his face out there since so many of my homegirls take the same train,” the Brooklyn-based writer wrote on social media Sunday. 

But when Jackson found a conductor to complain, he appeared uninterested in helping out, according to her account. 

STATE LAWMAKERS EYE TOUGHER PENALTIES FOR SUBWAY PERVERTS BUSTED FOR SEXUAL CONTACT 

“He rolled his eyes, annoyed, and radioed dispatch,” she wrote. 

“The conductor grumbled and told me to just go upstairs and report the incident to the booth,” she added. 

But there was no booth on her side of the station. With the creep following her into the Nevins St. stop, she hopped on the next train she could find. 

“Not upset about jerk-off guy, there are creeps all over this city,” she wrote. “I’m more upset how the MTA handled themselves.
